data.name: Find Nearest Number
data.description:
You are given an array of positive numbers and you have to return the nearest number in the array to a value.

For example :-

The array = {4, 7, 9, 13, 20} and the value = 11

The program should return 9

C++
```cpp
std::vector<int> = {4, 7, 9, 13, 20};
int value = 11;

Find_Nearest_Number(std::vector<int> array, int value) ----> 9
```
C
```c
size_t const size = 5;
int array[size] = {4, 7, 9, 13, 20};

Find_Nearest_Number(int array[], size_t size, int value) ----> 9
```

Because 9 is the nearest array element to the value.

if there was multiple closest values return first closest value.

1 <= size of array <= 100

1 <= value <= 100

Good Luck.
